text: How could I check if a number is a perfect square?
I'm pretty stumped with this one guys.
I'm trying to toy with Python (as you can see with my previous questions) so I'd really love some help here.
Speeds is of no concern for now, just working.
Edit: I ended up doing it this way:

code:
def isSquare(number):
    temp = math.sqrt(int(number))    
    if "." in str(abs(int(temp))):
        return False
    else:
        return True
